DataElement.preferredName: Index Breast Biopsy Order Reason Type

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Index; a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._The act of requesting that person, business, or organization supply something in return for payment._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Family History Genetic Disease or Disorder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Family; a domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.: Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells; inherited.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.
Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

PermissibleValues.value: Family history of malignant neoplasm of breast

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Family; a domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.: A bruise; an injury of a part without a break in the skin.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
A bruise due to trauma.
